entities.name: grindelwald
entities.description: Gellert Grindelwald is mentioned as a young leader who caught Dumbledore's attention with his ideas. He is described as someone who wants to force Muggles into subservience and have wizards triumphant.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the narrator of this passage and is talking about his past relationship with Grindelwald. He mentions that he had a few scruples but closed his eyes to what Grindelwald was really like.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the person Dumbledore is talking to and is being addressed directly by Dumbledore.

entities.name: deathly hallows
entities.description: The Deathly Hallows are mentioned as something that fascinated both Grindelwald and Dumbledore.

entities.name: muggles
entities.description: Muggles are mentioned as people who would be forced into subservience by Grindelwald's plans.

entities.name: village
entities.description: Dumbledore's village is mentioned as the place he returned to after his mother died.

entities.name: brother
entities.description: Dumbledore mentions that he has a wayward brother.

entities.name: sister
entities.description: Dumbledore mentions that he has a damaged sister.

relationships.description: Grindelwald's ideas caught Dumbledore and inflamed him.
The Deathly Hallows fascinated both Grindelwald and Dumbledore.
Grindelwald's plans would force Muggles into subservience.
Dumbledore returned to his village after his mother died.
